intro: Anacamptis × gennarii nothosubsp. kusadasiensis, commonly known as the Kusadasi hybrid orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to Turkey. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats. It is a perennial herb with a pseudobulbous structure, and its flowers are borne in racemes. This nothosubspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique genetic makeup and limited distribution.
